intro: Halenia corniculata, commonly known as the horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and related genera. The plant is characterized by its striking, orange-red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Halenia corniculata typically grows in moist, open woods and thrives in partial to full sunlight.
